events.title: Crocodile warnings as floods devastate southern Africa
events.description: More than 100 people killed and hundreds of thousands displaced in South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe Devastating floods have killed more than 100 people in southern Africa since the beginning of the year and displaced hundreds of thousands, as authorities and aid workers warn of hunger, cholera and attacks by crocodiles that have spread with the waters. More than 70 people have died in Zimbabwe and 30 in South Africa, where hundreds of people were evacuated from Kruger national park earlier this month after a deluge of rain . Continue reading...

events.title: Palestine Action Group plans ‘national day of protest’ as Herzog visit confirmed – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Sussan Ley says David Littleproud rejected offer of talks this week after Coalition break-up Analysis: Sussan Ley has two factors working in her favour as rumours of a Liberal leadership mutiny swirl Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The minister for defence industry, Pat Conroy , has refuted claims made by shadow frontbencher Andrew Bragg about the Muslim community. Earlier Bragg accused Australia’s Muslim community of needing to “take some responsibility” for the Bondi terror attack and for the federal government to make sure funding doesn’t go to “hate preachers”. We’ve been very clear these acts were committed by people who believed an extreme perversion of Islam and to try and hold the entire Islamic community responsible for these acts, I think, is anti to social cohesion. It’s incredibly unfair, and it’s not a recipe for taking this country forward. Some of the earliest people condemning the vile attacks in Bondi were leaders of our Muslim Australian community, and we’ll continue to support their right to practise in peace. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Doomsday Clock' ticks closer to midnight over global threats, group says
events.description: Doomsday Clock moves to 85 seconds to midnight as scientists warn of nuclear war, climate change and AI threats bringing humanity closer to catastrophe.

events.title: Five die in Russian attack on civilian train in Ukraine
events.description: Ukraine's ‍President ​Volodymyr Zelenskiy denounced ⁠as "terrorism" a Russian drone strike on ​a train ‍in northeastern ​Kharkiv region on ​January 27 and said four people had been killed. Meanwhile, a new report estimates Ukraine's dead and wounded around 500,000, while Russia's are twice as high. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg tells us more from Kherson.

events.title: Report warns that combined casualties in Russia's war on Ukraine could hit 2 million
events.description: A new report warns that the number of soldiers killed, injured or missing in Russia's war in Ukraine could reach 2 million by spring

events.title: UN chief warns ‘law of the jungle’ is replacing rule of law
events.description: Warning that the “rule of law is being replaced by the law of the jungle,” the UN Secretary-General on Monday urged world powers to recommit to international law as the foundation of peace, justice and multilateral cooperation.

events.title: Albanese to push states on gun buyback scheme despite opposition from Queensland and NT
events.description: Under the laws, which came in the wake of the Bondi terror attack, the states will be responsible for the collection and processing of surrendered guns Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Anthony Albanese will push national cabinet to thrash out details of the federal government’s looming gun buyback program , set to cost hundreds of millions of dollars, even as Queensland and the Northern Territory refuse to sign up. Friday’s meeting of national cabinet is focused on settling health and disability funding between premiers and the prime minister. But details to roll out the guns buyback – established in laws rushed through parliament last week in response to the Bondi beach terror attack – require swift agreement with state governments. Continue reading...

events.title: Italy criticises Crans Montana fire investigation
events.description: The Crans Montana fire on January 1rst killed 40, including six Italian and 9 French nationals, and injured 116 others. Investigations are underway over who is responsible, with charges having been filed against the owners of the bar. But critism is growing over how Swiss authorities are handing, and have handled, the case.

events.title: Remembering the Holocaust: ‘You are here because you choose hope over hate’
events.description: The Holocaust is a warning, that hatred “can consume everything” – a message that feels more urgent than ever, the UN chief said on Tuesday, as antisemitism rages worldwide.

events.title: Iran regime reportedly issued nationwide shoot-to-kill orders as protest death toll surges
events.description: Iran protest death toll estimates range from several thousand to over 35,000 as brutal crackdown intensifies. Medical data reveals shocking scale of violence.

events.title: The Trader Joe's tote bag goes global
events.description: Trader Joe's tote bags have become all the rage overseas. Why have the supermarket chain's bags become an international fashion statement?

events.title: West Virginia man allegedly threatened to kill Trump supporters, ICE agents in online videos: report
events.description: West Virginia man allegedly posted videos threatening Trump supporters and ICE agents, police say. Cody Smith, 20, arrested on terroristic charges.

events.title: How Israel’s West Bank security realities are reshaping the two-state debate
events.description: The West Bank remains central to Israel's security strategy as experts debate two-state solution viability following declining Palestinian terrorist incidents.

events.title: India: Deputy state leader among 5 killed in plane crash
events.description: Ajit Pawar, the deputy chief minister of Maharashtra, was on board a private plane that crashed in western India. There were no survivors from the crash.

events.title: US withdrawal from WHO ‘risks global safety’, agency says in detailed rebuttal
events.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a detailed statement regretting the United States decision to leave the UN agency, and declaring that it will leave both the US and the world less safe as a result.

events.title: Cameroon in shock after suspected separatist attack
events.description: Eight children were killed in an attack on a remote village in Cameroon's North West has shocked the nation. But there appears no end in sight to the separatist conflict in the Anglophone regions.

events.title: Who was Ajit Pawar, the Indian politician killed in plane crash?
events.description: Pawar was a key political figure and served as second-highest elected official in Maharashtra, India's wealthiest state.

events.title: Greetings from Mumbai, where residents take breathing space where they can find it
events.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

events.title: Iran's Internet partially restored as regime fears US intervention
events.description: US President Donald Trump appeared on January 28 to threaten another attack on Iran if it does not "make a deal" on nuclear weapons, after Tehran rejected talks. He also said another armada was on the way. FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah tells us more from Tehran, and tells us about the situation on the ground from there, where Internet has made a partial comeback.

events.title: ‘We must stand up for our shared humanity - each and every day’: UN human rights chief
events.description: On the eve of International Holocaust Remembrance Day, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called on the global community to “not only to look at our past, but to reflect on our present, and to safeguard our future.”

events.title: South Sudan: UN and rights experts warn against risk of mass violence in Jonglei
events.description: The UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS) is sounding the alarm over the threat of escalating violence in Jonglei state which is putting lives at risk and further weakening prospects for peace.

events.title: What we know about plane crash that killed Ajit Pawar
events.description: Authorities in India say they're investigating the cause of a plane crash that killed Ajit Pawar

events.title: Passengers killed in drone attack on Ukraine train
events.description: A Russian drone strike on a passenger train in Ukraine’s northeastern Kharkiv region has killed at least five people.

events.title: Amazon cuts more corporate jobs in post-pandemic downsize
events.description: Amazon told employees that it was cutting 16,000 corporate jobs, completing a downsizing move that began last year. The online retail giant had recruited during a COVID pandemic spike in demand.

events.title: Iranian security forces gun down amateur boxer near Tehran: source
events.description: Iranian security forces allegedly killed amateur boxer Sepehr Ebrahimi during ongoing protests near Tehran. The death adds to Iran's rising protest toll of at least 6,126 people killed.

events.title: Trump warns Iran 'time is running out' for nuclear deal as US military builds up in Gulf
events.description: Tehran says it is ready for dialogue with the US but will “respond like never before” if necessary.

events.title: Israel’s attacks on Gaza fertility clinics shatter dreams of parenthood
events.description: Israel's war has devastated enclave's reproductive health system; advocates call it a genocidal measure.

events.title: ‘It’s the sovereignty of the country’: Guinea-Bissau says US vaccine study suspended
events.description: Despite US pushback, officials in west Africa say controversial hepatitis B study on pause amid ethics concerns US health officials insisted it was still on. African health leaders said it was cancelled . At the heart of the controversy is the west African nation of Guinea-Bissau – one of the poorest countries in the world and the proposed site of a hotly debated US-funded study on vaccines. The study on hepatitis B vaccination, to be led by Danish researchers, became a flashpoint after major changes to the US vaccination schedule and prompted questions about how research is conducted ethically in other countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Zelenskyy condemns 'terrorism' after Russia hits train in Ukraine
events.description: A drone struck a train carriage carrying nearly 200 passengers in Ukraine, in an attack authorities blamed on Russia.

events.title: Russian drone attack on passenger train is an ‘act of terrorism,’ Zelenskyy says
events.description: Russian drones struck a passenger train in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, killing five in what Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called an act of terrorism.

events.title: Ted Cruz urges US to arm Iranian protesters as militias threaten ‘total war’ against America
events.description: Ted Cruz responds to reports describing rapidly deteriorating situation as Iran-backed militias threaten 'total war' against America. He called for the U.S. to arm Iranian protesters.

events.title: Starmer visits China to "deepen political connections and boost economic ties"
events.description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer said that his country doesn't have to choose between relations with the United States and China as he started a four-day trip to China aimed at repairing ties and expanding opportunities for British companies in the world’s second-largest economy. FRANCE 24's Jan Camenzind Broomby tells us more from Beijing.

events.title: From lunch tray to lifelong health: WHO sets global standards for school meals
events.description: For the first time ever, the World Health Organization (WHO) is providing recommendations for healthy and nutritious food in schools around the world.

events.title: Arizona man accused of human smuggling shot by federal authorities after firing at helicopter, agents: FBI
events.description: A shooting involving the U.S. Border Patrol prompted a law enforcement response in Arizona’s Arivaca area on Tuesday, local authorities said.

events.title: ActionAid to rethink child sponsorship as part of plan to ‘decolonise’ its work
events.description: Development charity’s new co-chief executives signal shift from controversial sponsor a child scheme launched in 1972 to long-term grassroots funding Child sponsorship schemes that allow donors to handpick children to support in poor countries can carry racialised, paternalistic undertones and need to be transformed, the newly appointed co-chief executives of ActionAid UK said as they set out to “decolonise” the organisation’s work. ActionAid began in 1972 by finding sponsors for schoolchildren in India and Kenya, but Taahra Ghazi and Hannah Bond have launched their co-leadership this month with the goal of shifting narratives around aid from sympathy towards solidarity and partnership with global movements. Continue reading...

events.title: France "early" defender of European sovereignty and Greenland
events.description: Speaking alongside the prime ministers of Denmark and Greenland, Mette Frederiksen and Jens-Frederik Nielsen, Macron said Europe's strategic "awakening" must focus "on asserting our European sovereignty, on our contribution to Arctic security, on the fight against foreign interference and disinformation, and on the fight against global warming." FRANCE 24's James André tells us more on the French view from Paris.

events.title: US Secretary of State Rubio to testify before Congress about Venezuela
events.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio plans to warn Congress that President Donald Trump is ready to take new military action against Venezuela if the country’s interim leadership strays from U.S. expectations. He will again reject allegations that Trump is violating the Constitution by taking such actions, and that it is not a war. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson tells us what to know from Washington.

events.title: North Korea's Kim says upcoming party congress will unveil plans to bolster nuclear deterrent
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un says his country will unveil plans to further bolster its nuclear program at the upcoming ruling party congress

events.title: USS Abraham Lincoln Aircraft Carrier Strike Group makes move amid threat from Iran
events.description: USS Abraham Lincoln entered CENTCOM waters Monday amid escalating threats from Iran and the potential for a "credible" drone attack on the U.S.

events.title: Veteran Indian politician Ajit Pawar dies in plane crash
events.description: Pawar and four others died after the plane they were travelling in crashed in India's Maharashtra state.

events.title: Sudan’s war displaced crisis peaks as millions eye return to ruined homes
events.description: Sudan hosts 14 million displaced people, but a fragile trend of return to Khartoum is emerging, despite ruins.

events.title: At least three people killed in Russian attacks on Ukraine
events.description: Russia used an Iskander-M ballistic missile and 146 drones in its attacks, according to Ukraine's air force.

events.title: Trump admin rewrites nuclear safety rules. And, NTSB releases findings on D.C. crash
events.description: NPR obtains documents showing the Trump administration secretly cut nuclear safety rules to fast-track new reactors. And, investigators blame systemic failures for a deadly midair crash near D.C.

events.title: Trump makes new threats against Iran over nuclear deal
events.description: Iran is back in US President Donald Trump's focus after he appears to have rolled back his threats over Greenland. This time, German Chancellor Merz also said the Iranian government's "days are numbered."

events.title: 'Three million' pro-government protesters in Tehran? Fact-checking Iranian state media
events.description: Pro-government demonstrations were held across Iran on January 12. In the capital, Tehran, Iranian state media reported that “three million” protesters took to the streets. But our analysis suggests these figures are significantly inflated.

events.title: Swedish amusement park fined over 2023 roller coaster derailment that killed 1
events.description: A Swedish amusement park has been fined nearly $588,000 in connection with a fatal 2023 roller coaster derailment

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: ‘Air conditioners are struggling’: parts of NSW, Queensland and Victoria swelter as heat records tumble
events.description: Bushfires still burning out of control in Victoria as temperatures reached the high 40s in the west of NSW Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast People across significant parts of western New South Wales, south-western Queensland, Victoria and the ACT have suffered through another day of sweltering conditions, with more local records tumbling around the country and temperatures in some alpine areas exceeding 30C for the first time. Temperatures reached the high 40s again in the west of NSW, climbing to 49.2C at Borrona Downs in the far west. All-time heat records were set at Tibooburra (48.7C), Hay Airport in south-western NSW (48.4C) and White Cliffs, which at 48.3C broke the record of 48.2C set the previous day. Yarrawonga in north-east Victoria had its hottest day, reaching 46C. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Cycle of attacks must end’: Lead UN official in Ukraine
events.description: The senior UN official in Ukraine, Matthias Schmale, has issued a condemnation of the massive overnight Russian drone and missile strike on several major Ukrainian cities, killing and injuring civilians, and knocking out energy infrastructure amid sub-zero temperatures.

events.title: Retired NYPD officer collapses, dies shoveling snow for churchgoers during devastating Northeast winter storm
events.description: Retired NYPD sergeant Roger McGovern, 60, reportedly died of heart attack while shoveling snow at his Long Island church preparing for Sunday mass.

events.title: China slams Trump administration over US sanctions on Cuba
events.description: China strongly condemns U.S. pressure on Cuba, calling sanctions violations of international law as diplomatic tensions escalate over decades-long embargo.

events.title: Chinese hackers reportedly breached phones at 'heart of Downing Street' in global spy campaign
events.description: Chinese state-linked hackers reportedly breached phones "at the heart of Downing Street," and allegedly accessed the phone data of millions.

events.title: Republicans wrestle with immigration message after Minneapolis backlash
events.description: Some lawmakers are questioning the crackdown as public anger grows over two citizens killed by federal agents.

events.title: Can Venezuela’s Delcy Rodríguez become a Latin American Deng Xiaoping?
events.description: Maduro’s Sorbonne-educated successor is talking up an era of ‘reform and opening up’ modelled on China’s post-Mao boom After years of political and social upheaval, hunger and despair, the Great Helmsman departs and is replaced by a francophile economic reformer who catapults a traumatised country into a new era of prosperity and growth . That is what happened in China half a century ago when the croissant-loving communist Deng Xiaoping became paramount leader after Chairman Mao Zedong’s 1976 death and set in motion one of history’s biggest economic booms. Continue reading...

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.description: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: Killing of US citizens in Minneapolis 'a turning point', former US border chief says
events.description: Gil Kerlikowske, who served as US Customs and Border Protection commissioner from 2014 to 2017 under President Barack Obama, told FRANCE 24 in an interview that the killing of protesters Renee Good and Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis marks "a turning point" for the United States.

events.title: Greenland: What do we know about ongoing NATO-US talks for a framework?
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron will be hosting the leaders of Denmark and Greenland on January 28 to reaffirm support for the territory's sovereignty and their alliance. On a trip to Paris's Sciences Po University, Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen reiterated that "the best way forward is for Europe to stick together and to find a way forward with the United States over shared Arctic Security concerns." The visit comes as negotiations are continuing with Washington. But what do we know about it?

events.title: 'The dream of climbing Everest never left me': French mountaineer Orianne Aymard
events.description: One of the few French women to climb Mount Everest has spoken to FRANCE 24 about her long-term dream to climb the world's highest mountain. Orianne Aymard made the climb despite several nasty accidents in earlier climbs, and she had a brain haemorrhage at the age of 25 that temporarily put the brakes on her life mission. Her exploits are celebrated in a new film and in two books that she herself has written, "L'appel de l'Everest" and "Au coeur de l'Everest". She spoke to us in Perspective.

events.title: Zelensky condemns Russian drone strike that killed five on passenger train
events.description: Drones targeted a packed train in north-eastern Ukraine, officials say.

events.title: 'We all know someone who was killed' -  Iran protesters tell BBC of brutal crackdown
events.description: Young Iranians able tell the BBC how they saw friends and other people die as security forces crushed protests earlier this month.

events.title: Trump reiterates threat of military action with demand for Iran deal
events.description: Fears of US attack rise as president says Tehran can either negotiate 'a fair and equitable deal' or face a US 'armada'.

events.title: Ex-FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins those calling for boycott of World Cup in U.S.
events.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

events.title: Around 300 people evacuated after fire at hotels in French Alps, officials say
events.description: Around 300 people were evacuated from two hotels in the ski resort of Courchevel in the French Alps because of a fire, according to officials. No one was ‍injured in the blaze, which started around 7pm on Tuesday.

events.title: Senior politician dies in India plane crash
events.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has paid tribute after a minister was killed in a plane crash which left no survivors.

events.title: From deepfakes to grooming: UN warns of escalating AI threats to children
events.description: The staggering amount of harmful AI-generated online content has prompted an urgent call from across the UN system for a raft of measures to protect children from abuse, exploitation and mental trauma.

events.title: Trump launches midterm push in Iowa with crucial warning and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Well-known Texas attorney’s wife among victims of deadly private jet crash in Maine
events.description: Family and friends identified the victims of a deadly Maine plane crash that killed six people aboard a private jet at Bangor airport Sunday night during takeoff.

events.title: SEE IT: Missing teen drives stolen SUV over 115 mph, crosses into oncoming traffic before rollover crash
events.description: Teen driver allegedly reaches 115+ mph in stolen SUV before rollover crash. Dashcam video shows dangerous high-speed chase along Georgia roads.

events.title: Virginia school safety director charged with DUI after winter storm
events.description: Arlington Public Schools employee Aaron Queen was charged with a DUI after a winter storm incident. The district says it's cooperating with a police investigation.

events.title: Netanyahu sounds alarm on antisemitism at Holocaust Remembrance Day gathering
events.description: Antisemitism surge prompts leaders to gather in Jerusalem for Holocaust Remembrance Day conference. Netanyahu warns ideology threatens Western civilization.

events.title: Video: Mozambique floods force thousands into displacement camps
events.description: Flooding in southern Mozambique has forced thousands of families to flee to informal displacement camps.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Head of US Africa bureau urges staff to highlight US ‘generosity’ despite aid cuts
events.description: Email sent to diplomats by state department office’s new boss is labelled ‘racist’ after dismissing Africa as a priority US diplomats have been encouraged to “unabashedly and aggressively” remind African governments about the “generosity” of the American people, according to a leaked email sent to staff in the US state department’s Bureau of African Affairs this January and obtained by the Guardian. “It’s not gauche to remind these countries of the American people’s generosity in containing HIV/Aids or alleviating famine,” says the email. Continue reading...

events.title: Rubio braces for Senate scrutiny over Venezuela
events.description: At his first Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing since Nicolas Maduro was seized, Secretary of State Marco Rubio warns the U.S. could still use force to pressure Venezuela's adminstration.

events.title: World News in Brief: Deadly shipwrecks in the Mediterranean, Duterte trial update, final hostage remains recovered in Gaza, FAO boosts farming in Haiti
events.description: The UN migration agency, IOM, expressed deep concern on Monday over multiple deadly shipwrecks that are believed to have taken place over the past ten days across the Central Mediterranean.

events.title: Man guilty of assault after Barron Trump reported attack to UK police
events.description: Donald Trump's son told officers he had seen the victim being beaten up during a video call in January 2025.

events.title: Designating the Domain a protest site? The changes Minns is considering to avoid ‘unnecessary burden’ from demonstrations
events.description: NSW premier also said to be considering altering the form 1 system which protects protesters as polling shows increased support for strengthening police powers Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The NSW premier, Chris Minns, is understood to be considering changes to the form 1 system and land use policies to curtail protests in the Sydney CBD. A poll of 1,022 Australians conducted between Tuesday and Friday last week revealed 62% of respondents nationally and the same proportion in NSW, supported strengthening police powers to curb protests, with just 17% opposing; 38% said they “strongly support”. Continue reading...

events.title: Security Council LIVE: Ambassadors debate as Middle East crises mount
events.description: The UN Security Council is holding a high-level open debate on the Middle East which is expected to focus on the Gaza peace plan – including the role of President Donald Trump’s Board of Peace – the continuing humanitarian crisis in the enclave and turmoil in the West Bank and East Jerusalem, following the demolition of UNRWA’s headquarters there. Follow live coverage below, and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: Skier suffers brutal mauling after stepping within 10 feet of snow leopard for photo, video shows
events.description: Female skier survives snow leopard mauling in China's Fuyun County after authorities warned tourists about predator sightings near hotel, according to reports.

events.title: China experts raise alarms over Xi’s sweeping military purge
events.description: Military turmoil in China raises Taiwan invasion concerns as Xi Jinping removes senior officers. Analysts warn of growing instability despite control.

events.title: Trump says government will 'de-escalate' in Minnesota following Pretti shooting
events.description: The killing of Alex Pretti over the weekend led Minnesota officials and locals to renew calls for Trump to end his immigration operation there.

events.title: Sara in Southern Lebanon
events.description: Sara Rammal was forced to flee her hometown in southern Lebanon because of Israeli military attacks in October 2023.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Guyanese businessman facing US extradition elected opposition leader
events.description: Azruddin Mohamed’s election comes six months after he formed political party that became country’s second largest A Guyanese businessman facing extradition to the US on gold-smuggling and money-laundering charges has been elected as the country’s opposition leader, six months after he formed a political party that quickly became the second largest in the South American country . Azruddin Mohamed, 38, was confirmed as Guyana’s opposition leader after 16 lawmakers from the We Invest in Nationhood party (Win) and another from a single-seat outfit voted in his favor. The tally made Win the second-largest party in parliament, securing Mohamed’s election even as a magistrate’s court hears state arguments for his extradition to the US. Continue reading...

events.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
events.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.

events.title: ICE on US streets challenges American norms, founding values
events.description: The Trump administration has moved ICE's center of activity from the border with Mexico to the heart of US cities. Federal agents' encounters with the public are challenging the foundational ideas of the United States.

events.title: Regime crackdown: Life inside Iran
events.description: 👉Listen to The World with Richard Engel and Yalda Hakim on your podcast app👈

events.title: Amazon to cut 16,000 jobs globally
events.description: Amazon has told staff it plans to cut around 16,000 jobs globally as part of efforts to streamline operations and reduce bureaucracy across the business.

events.title: Landslide in Sicily causes homes to fall off cliff edge
events.description: Heavy rain has tiggered a landslide in southern Sicily causing the edge of a town to collapse and forcing the evacuation of more than 1,500 people.

events.title: Doomsday Clock moved closer to midnight than ever: What is it and how does it work?
events.description: The Doomsday Clock has been moved closer than ever to midnight by scientists, a change that is said to signify that we are edging closer to the end of the world.

events.title: ASEAN's top diplomats under pressure to end Myanmar war and finalize South China Sea pact
events.description: Southeast Asia’s top diplomats are holding their first major meeting in the central Philippine city of Cebu under growing pressure to beat a deadline to conclude talks on a nonaggression pact with China this year and push a peace plan that has so far f...

events.title: Young people must be ‘truly involved’ in transforming education
events.description: With young people under 30 making up more than half of the global population and over 272 million children and youth still out of school, their participation in shaping education is becoming increasingly vital.

events.title: 90-year-old woman who wandered outside during winter storm among 10 dead in New York City
events.description: A 90-year-old woman with dementia was among 10 people who died in New York City during the winter storm after wandering outside in frigid temperatures.

events.title: Minn anti-Border Patrol riot backfires as agitators allegedly hurl objects at cops, arrests expose rap sheets
events.description: Minnesota mob turns violent as arrestees with criminal records allegedly damage property outside hotel where Border Patrol commander was staying.

events.title: VCU anti-ICE nurse fired after referencing paralytic drug in video instructing 'sabotage' of ICE agents
events.description: VCU nurse allegedly posted TikTok videos instructing viewers to use paralytics and poison ivy against ICE agents, prompting a police investigation and administrative leave.

events.title: 'I don't let bullies win,' says US congresswoman Omar after substance thrown at her
events.description: The Minnesota Democrat was uninjured and continued to speak at her event, after being sprayed with an unidentified liquid.

events.title: 'I couldn't save them' - US mum's horror as three sons die falling through pond ice
events.description: Their mother says she tried to rescue them by lifting them out but the ice kept breaking.

events.title: How Israeli destruction of Gaza fertility clinics erased parenthood dreams
events.description: Israel’s destruction of fertility clinics in its war on Gaza left thousands of Palestinians mourning unborn children.

events.title: Israeli plans for Rafah ‘camp’ in Gaza slammed as continuation of genocide
events.description: An Israeli 'organised camp' in Rafah would use facial recognition as a 'sorting' tool to deter return, analyst warns.

events.title: Tens of thousands flee northwest Pakistan’s Tirah over fears
events.description: Defence minister denies plans to attack the Pakistan Taliban in Tirah as tens of thousands flee the border region.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Hundreds feared dead in attempt to cross Mediterranean during cyclone
events.description: Fifty killed in one incident as Italian authorities estimate 380 people may have drowned last week Up to 380 people may have drowned attempting to cross the Mediterranean last week as Cyclone Harry battered southern Italy and Malta, the Italian coastguard has said, as a shipwreck with the loss of 50 lives was confirmed by Maltese authorities. Just one person, who was hospitalised in Malta, survived the shipwreck, which happened on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Five-year-old deported to Honduras despite being US citizen is latest child victim of Trump crackdown
events.description: Mother whose visa application was pending says she will send girl back to US soon accompanied by another relative Five-year-old Génesis Ester Gutiérrez Castellanos misses her cousins, classmates and kindergarten teachers in Austin, Texas. Despite being a US citizen, she was deported on 11 January alongside her mother, Karen Guadalupe Gutiérrez Castellanos, to Honduras, a country Génesis had never known. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents were acting on an administrative deportation order against Gutiérrez, 26, issued in 2019, before Génesis was born. Continue reading...

events.title: Kim Keon Hee, wife of South Korea’s ousted president, jailed for corruption
events.description: Ex-first lady sentenced to 20 months for receiving gifts for political favours, as Yoon Suk Yeol awaits rebellion verdict The wife of South Korea’s ousted president Yoon Suk Yeol has been sentenced to 20 months in prison for corruption, as her husband awaits a verdict on a high-stakes rebellion charge that could result in the death penalty or life imprisonment. Kim Keon Hee was sentenced for receiving luxury gifts including a Graff diamond necklace and a Chanel bag from the Unification Church in return for promises of political favours. Continue reading...

events.title: Starmer vows to raise issues ‘that need to be raised’ with Xi amid push to free Jimmy Lai
events.description: PM may also discuss fate of Uyghurs with Chinese leader on trip aimed at improving economic relations ‘Very low bar’: Starmer faces slim pickings in China Keir Starmer has said he will “raise the issues that need to be raised” on human rights with China’s president, Xi Jinping , as he arrived in Beijing for the first trip to the country by a UK leader in eight years. The prime minister has come under pressure from rights groups to try to secure the release of Jimmy Lai , the jailed former media tycoon and one of Hong Kong’s most significant pro-democracy voices. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Not radical, it’s fair’: Australian households would receive compensation in proposed ‘polluter pays levy’ scheme
events.description: Superpower Institute report fleshes out 2024 call from Labor heavyweight Ross Garnaut to re-embrace carbon pricing 12 years after Tony Abbott axed it Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Albanese government could make deep emissions cuts and restructure an ailing federal budget by taxing polluting companies more than $35bn a year for the damage they cause to the planet, according to a report backed by senior economists and ex-public servants. The analysis by the Superpower Institute – overseen by the longtime Labor adviser Ross Garnaut and former consumer watchdog chair Rod Sims, and supported by ex-Treasury head Ken Henry – makes a case for the introduction of a “polluter pays levy” on companies that extract or import fossil fuels consumed in Australia. Continue reading...

events.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics
events.description: U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.

events.title: 'Not just a police matter': Battling drug trade also 'sociopolitical', depends on schools & families
events.description: Eve Irvine welcomes Professor Federico Varese, Criminologist and Professor at Oxford University. Cocaine trade and consumption in Europe is expanding and embedding itself ever more deeply into the social and geopolitical fabric of the continent. It's a complex ecosystem where increased production in Colombia, inventive trafficking routes through Africa, and technological innovations like drones and submersibles are pushing the limits of law enforcement. All the while, we are reminded that the war on drugs begins in the home and school.

events.title: ICE victim wasn't a 'would-be assassin', Trump says
events.description: Donald Trump has appeared to distance himself from controversial remarks by senior members of his administration about ICE shooting victim Alex Pretti.

events.title: India says it has contained Nipah virus outbreak
events.description: Indian authorities have contained a Nipah virus outbreak after confirming two cases in eastern West Bengal state

events.title: UN says Gaza crisis remains dire, children hardest hit
events.description: Despite a modest increase in humanitarian assistance, the situation in Gaza remains “dire”, with children among the hardest hit by shortages of shelter, basic services and education, the United Nations said on Tuesday.

events.title: Between fear and survival: Women and girls flee violence in northern Syria
events.description: When fighting recently intensified near her neighbourhood in Aleppo, in northern Syria, Fatima and her family had to run.

events.title: Keeping people warm amid hostilities and harsh winter weather in Ukraine
events.description: As people in war-torn Ukraine face the coldest winter in more than a decade, authorities and humanitarians are working to help them stay warm, particularly the most vulnerable residents.

events.title: Utah children’s author Kouri Richins says state threatened witnesses ahead of trial in husband’s poisoning
events.description: Utah mother accused of poisoning husband faces witness intimidation claims before murder trial. Defense alleges prosecution threatened witnesses.

events.title: From 700 murdered relatives to 3 survivors: Holocaust descendant leads Israeli forces after Oct 7 attacks
events.description: Israeli colonel whose parents survived Holocaust continues military service at the age of 56, serving over 3,600 days in reserves including Gaza operations.

events.title: Lawmakers in German state elect new governor to counter far-right rise
events.description: Lawmakers in an eastern German state have elected a new governor as mainstream parties try to prevent a victory for the far-right Alternative for Germany in a regional election that is only seven months away

events.title: A new blow for UNRWA as headquarters in East Jerusalem 'set on fire'
events.description: The head of embattled UN relief agency for Palestinians, UNRWA, has condemned reports that its headquarters in East Jerusalem have been set alight deliberately.

events.title: Young brothers die after trying desperately to help each other in icy pond during winter storm: report
events.description: Three elementary school brothers, ages 6, 8 and 9, tragically died after getting into difficulty in an icy pond during a Texas winter storm, authorities said.

events.title: Venezuela and Mexico: How Trump is trying to choke Cuba’s oil supplies
events.description: Cuba's economy is on the verge of collapse as two of the country's top oil supplies dry up amid US pressure.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Mexico’s president says cancellation of oil shipment to Cuba is ‘sovereign’ decision
events.description: Claudia Sheinbaum denied move was response to pressure from the US, after Trump said ‘zero’ oil would go to Cuba Mexico has cancelled a shipment of oil to Cuba , the country’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, appeared to confirm on Tuesday, but she insisted the decision was “sovereign” and not a response to pressure from the US. Fuel shortages are causing increasingly severe blackouts in Cuba, and Mexico has been the island’s biggest oil supplier since the US blocked shipments from Venezuela last month. Continue reading...

events.title: Sussan Ley says David Littleproud rejected offer of talks this week after Coalition breakup
events.description: Nationals leader says meeting will be scheduled once party’s spill motion is determined Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Sussan Ley has said David Littleproud turned down her offer for last-minute peace talks ahead of parliament’s return next week, but the Nationals leader says a time will be scheduled after the party’s upcoming leadership contest. In a message to Liberal MPs on Wednesday, Ley said she had written to Littleproud on Tuesday night proposing a meeting “without any preconditions” to discuss the two parties’ relationship after last week’s spectacular breakup. Continue reading...

events.title: Spain will grant legal status to immigrants lacking authorization
events.description: Spain's government announced Tuesday it will grant legal status to potentially hundreds of thousands of immigrants living and working in the country without authorization.

events.title: German police search Deutsche Bank offices in money-laundering probe
events.description: German police searched Deutsche Bank's Frankfurt headquarters and its Berlin office on Wednesday as part of a money-laundering investigation. Local media said the probe was connected to suspected offences in the bank's dealings with companies linked to Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich.

events.title: Pooja Dhingra, the pastry chef who blends French craft with Indian flavours
events.description: In this edition of Entre Nous we speak with Pooja Dhingra, founder of Le15 Patisserie in India. Pooja trained at the renowned Cordon Bleu school in Paris, before returning to India and becoming one of the country's most successful food entrepreneurs. She tells us about introducing India to French pastries, especially the popular macaron.

events.title: Putin is hosting Syria's interim leader for talks, with Russian military bases on the agenda
events.description: Syria’s interim leader has arrived in Moscow for his second time in less than four months for talks, which are expected to focus on the future of Russian military bases in the country

events.title: Spain to grant legal status to thousands of immigrants lacking permission
events.description: Spain's government has announced it will grant legal status to potentially hundreds of thousands of immigrants living and working in the country without authorization

events.title: Days after a disputed election, Uganda's army is on the hunt for opposition leader Bobi Wine
events.description: A military hunt is underway in Uganda opposition leader Bobi Wine, whom the country's army chief is calling a wanted fugitive

events.title: Independent experts alarmed by child rights violations in US immigration procedures
events.description: UN-appointed independent human rights experts have raised alarm over violations of children’s rights during US immigration procedures, nearly a year after federal funding for legal representation for unaccompanied minors was terminated.

events.title: Vandals hit Yosemite National Park with graffiti on boulder, more
events.description: Vandals spray-painted "Yeti" graffiti on boulder, door and sign near Bridalveil Falls Trail at Yosemite National Park, sparking widespread outrage online.

events.title: Dozens arrested after protesters take over NYC hotel lobby during anti-ICE demonstration
events.description: Dozens arrested after anti-ICE protesters took over New York City hotel lobby, chanting against immigration enforcement and refusing to leave the Tribeca location.

events.title: Federal judge blocks deportation of 5-year-old boy and father taken in Minnesota immigration operation
events.description: A federal judge blocked the deportation of 5-year-old Ecuadorian boy and father detained by immigration authorities in Minnesota last week amid legal challenge.

events.title: Amazon confirms 16,000 job cuts after accidental email
events.description: The technology giant confirmed the redundancies hours after it told staff in an email sent in error.

events.title: Former Iraqi PM Maliki denounces Trump threats to end support if he returns to power
events.description: The US president said Iraq would have "zero" chance of success without American support.

events.title: Israel’s phase one Gaza ceasefire violations
events.description: As the US moves to launch phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, a closer look at how Israel has fallen short on phase one.

events.title: Israel holds funeral for last remaining Gaza hostage
events.description: Ran Gvili's funeral marks the end of a painful chapter in Israel and could see the start of the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.description: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: Western alliance in the balance: Europe seeks renewed 'predictability from the US on trade, defence'
events.description: Delano D'Souza is pleased to welcome Ian Lesser, Author and Senior Director for Foreign and Security Policy at the German Marshall Fund (GMF). In the wake of high-level talks in Davos, amid tariff threats, military exercises, and diverging transatlantic visions, we find ourselves at a complex geopolitical chessboard, as Mr. Lesser explains: "The US provides things Europe will not be able to replace for many years to come, even if it spends more or does more."

events.title: France announces designation of new Greenland consul
events.description: European powers have sought to join forces to show they can stand on their own feet after US President Donald Trump has roiled the transatlantic alliance by threatening to seize Greenland. At a joint press conference with Danish and Greenlandic PMs, French President Emmanuel Macron announced a French consul to Greenland had been designated and would soon take office. FRANCE 24's james André tells us more from Paris.

events.title: Greenland is "a strategic wake-up call for Europe" says France's Macron
events.description: France, Denmark and Greenland's leaders addressed journalists in Paris on January 28, as Europe tries to reiterate its support to Greenland faced with threats of a US takeover. Emmanuel Macron confirmed that France supports the reinforcement of the defence position in the Arctic, ahead of a meeting with Mette Frederiksen and Jens-Frederik Nielsen.

events.title: Al-Maliki is defiant after Trump threatens to withdraw US support for Iraq
events.description: Former Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki has expressed defiance after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to withdraw support for Iraq if he returns to power

events.title: A private plane crashes in western India and kills a deputy chief minister and 4 others
events.description: A private plane carrying a deputy chief minister has crashed in western India, killing the official and four other people

events.title: Gaza ceasefire improves aid access, but children still face deadly conditions
events.description: The fragile ceasefire in the Gaza Strip is making a difference to the lives of over a million children, and improving overall access to food - but more aid still needs to enter.

events.title: Trump says Iran called 'numerous' times to make deal as carrier enters Middle East waters
events.description: President Donald Trump indicated Iran is seeking negotiations as the USS Abraham Lincoln carrier enters the region and protests continue inside Iran.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Iraq faces return of ex-PM linked to 'Islamic State' rise
events.description: Ex-prime minister Nouri al-Maliki is often seen as responsible for sectarian tensions and military mismanagement that made the "Islamic State" possible in Iraq. He's just been nominated as Iraq's next prime minister.

events.title: Replay: France's Macron, Denmark and Greenland leaders give joint press conference
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said Wednesday a standoff with the United States over Greenland was "a strategic wake-up call for all of Europe", speaking alongside the prime ministers of Denmark and the Danish autonomous territory. Watch his joint press conference with Denmark's Mette Frederiksen and Jens-Frederik Nielsen of Greenland.

events.title: Tech tycoon husband arrested after wife found dead below mountain highway in wealthy enclave
events.description: A tech executive is accused of killing his wife during a $4.5 million divorce battle. Aryan Papoli's body was discovered 75 feet below a highway in the Crestline area.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Activists fear U.S. visa restrictions for Palestinians will hurt diplomacy
events.description: Palestinians can no longer apply for a U.S. visa with documents issued by the Palestinian Authority — another sign, they say, that the Trump administration is sidelining Palestinians.

events.title: Minneapolis: Democratis US Rep. Ilhan Omar sprayed by unknown substance during speech
events.description: #US' Democratic congresswomen Ilhan Omar, frequently targeted by Donald #Trump, was interrupted Tuesday during a town hall meeting in #Minneapolis when a man threw liquid at her before being tackled to the ground. She was speaking about #ICE’s actions shaking the city.

events.title: Limited access restored to Syria’s Al Hol camp amid security concerns
events.description: United Nations agencies have regained limited access to Syria’s Al Hol camp and resumed the delivery of essential supplies after days of disruption caused by a volatile security situation, the UN Deputy Spokesperson said on Friday.

events.title: Accused surgeon Michael McKee allegedly lurked at ex-wife's home weeks before double murder: report
events.description: A surgeon allegedly stalked his ex-wife weeks before a Columbus double murder, new court documents reveal. Michael McKee is accused of lurking at the victims' home.

events.title: Russia reportedly slams Trump’s Golden Dome as 'provocative' as trillion-dollar shield takes shape
events.description: Russia reportedly called the U.S. Golden Dome missile defense project "provocative" as an expert says Russia's reaction shows the system's power as a bargaining chip.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Stable genius? How a defective ‘crying horse’ toy went viral in China
events.description: Toy becomes a popular symbol of workplace fatigue after manufacturing error gave it a frown instead of a smile On 17 February China will celebrate the start of the year of the horse, the zodiac sign symbolising high energy and hard work. But the runaway success of a defective stuffed toy suggests that many Chinese are not feeling the vibe. A red horse toy produced by Happy Sister in the city of Yiwu in the west of China was meant to wear a broad grin, but a factory error meant it hit the shops sporting a despairing grimace. Because the smile was placed upside down, the horse’s nostrils could be interpreted as tears. Continue reading...

events.title: ICE agents to have role at Winter Olympics - but told they are 'not welcome'
events.description: ICE agents will have a security role at the Winter Olympics in Italy, it has been revealed, after the man who led the Trump administration's crackdown in Minneapolis was moved out of the city.

events.title: Huge landslide cleaves off the edge of a town in Sicily
events.description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni has toured a southern Sicilian town where days of heavy rains triggered a massive landslide that cleaved off the town's edge

events.title: Yemen: Security Council votes on final extension of Hudaydah Mission
events.description: The Security Council adopted a resolution on Tuesday that renews the mandate of the UN Mission in the Yemeni port city of Hudaydah for a final two-month period through 31 March of this year.

events.title: Soros-backed Philadelphia DA vows to 'hunt' down ICE agents: 'We will find you'
events.description: Philadelphia DA Larry Krasner vows to "hunt" down ICE agents, calling them "wannabe Nazis" as city introduces legislation to limit immigration enforcement.

events.title: China trip will bring benefits to UK, Starmer insists, ahead of Xi meeting
events.description: The prime minister seeks to strengthen ties with China but faces fierce criticism from opponents at home.

events.title: Europe must act urgently and stop outsourcing defence, says EU's Kallas
events.description: The EU foreign policy chief's remarks come days after Nato's secretary general said Europe needed the US for its defence.

events.title: Ecuador says ICE agent attempted to enter its Minneapolis consulate
events.description: A complaint has been filed by Ecuador, whose consular staff prevented the agent from entering.

events.title: South Korea's ex-first lady jailed for 20 months for bribery
events.description: Kim Keon Hee was also ordered to return a Graff diamond necklace and pay back 12.85m won in cash.

events.title: Rwanda seeks £100m from UK over axed asylum deal
events.description: The African nation argues it is owed payments but the Home Office says it will fight the case.

events.title: Malaysia football officials quit over foreign-born players scandal
events.description: Fifa had accused Malaysia's football association of doctoring citizenship documents.

events.title: US YouTube star IShowSpeed to get Ghanaian passport as Africa tour ends
events.description: Ghana's foreign minister says the influencer is a "worthy ambassador", but some Ghanaians criticised the move.

events.title: Former French senator found guilty of drugging MP
events.description: Joel Guerriau received a four-year prison sentence, 18 months of which are to be served behind bars.

events.title: Mexico president asks South Korea for more BTS concerts
events.description: About a million fans were vying for 150,000 concert tickets, which sold out in less than 40 minutes.

events.title: Al-Sharaa meets Putin as Russia seeks to secure military bases in Syria
events.description: Kremlin has not indicated whether it will agree to al-Sharaa's repeated requests for Bashar al-Assad's extradition.

events.title: China pitches itself as a reliable partner as Trump alienates US allies
events.description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is the latest US ally to visit Beijing, pursuing renewed ties and trade deals.

events.title: Hungary charges Budapest mayor for allowing banned pride march
events.description: Prosecutors seek fine against Mayor Gergely Karacsony 'without a trial'.

events.title: ICE, Ilhan Omar and Somalis: Unpacking Trump’s obsession with Minnesota
events.description: Congresswoman Omar is sprayed with an unknown liquid while meeting constituents. The motive is unknown.

events.title: Tech giant ASML announces record orders in boost for AI boom
events.description: Dutch firm says it expects strong growth in 2026, countering fears of an investment bubble.

events.title: Oxfam refuses to provide Israel with details of Palestinian staff in Gaza
events.description: The UK-founded charity will not adhere to Israel's demand as observers fear data could be used to target aid workers.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Canadian ex-Olympian pleads not guilty to 17 felonies including drug trafficking
events.description: Authorities allege Ryan Wedding, 44, ‘turned to a life of crime’ after his snowboarding career ended Ryan Wedding, the Canadian former Olympic snowboarder accused of cocaine distribution and orchestrating several murders, appeared on Monday in a southern California courtroom for arraignment. The 44-year-old has been charged with drug trafficking, conspiracy to murder, witness tampering and money laundering, among other charges. Authorities allege that after his snowboarding career, Wedding “turned to a life of crime” as a narcotics trafficker and led an organization that moved cocaine from South America to the US and Canada. Continue reading...

events.title: Starmer says Reform pursuing politics of ‘toxic division’ after Matt Goodwin unveiled as byelection candidate
events.description: Prime minister says Reform seeking to ‘tear people apart’ after Gorton and Denton candidate questions whether all UK-born people are British Keir Starmer has accused the Reform UK candidate in the Greater Manchester byelection of pursuing the politics of “toxic division” after he refused to disown his claim that UK-born people from minority ethnic backgrounds are not necessarily British. The prime minister suggested that Matthew Goodwin, a hard-right activist, would try to “tear people apart” in Gorton and Denton, and that voters wanting to stop Nigel Farage’s party should coalesce around the Labour candidate. Continue reading...

events.title: M 5.5 - 9 km ESE of Dianga, China

events.title: M 4.7 - 40 km S of Evanston, Wyoming

events.title: EU signs 'mother of all deals' to boost trade with India
events.description: The European Union has signed what India's prime minister has called "the mother of all deals" to boost trade with India. For Europe, the move seeks to hedge against its unpredictable ties to the U.S.

events.title: Germany's fight over "lifestyle" part-time work
events.description: A proposal from the economic wing of Germany’s CDU to place tighter restrictions on part-time contracts has come under hefty criticism. Chancellor Merz has repeatedly criticized the German work ethic in the past year.

events.title: Should Europe worry about euro strength and dollar weakness?
events.description: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for European companies and consumers, but few think the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Germany news: Deutsche Bank raided in money laundering probe
events.description: Deutsche Bank's headquarters in Frankfurt and an office in Berlin were searched. The German government also lowered its growth forecast for 2026. DW has the latest headlines from Germany.

events.title: Israel eyes opening Rafah crossing, Gaza's gate to Egypt
events.description: After being closed since May 2024, the Rafah crossing will likely soon reopen, allowing people to move between Gaza and Egypt again. The prospect gives Palestinians hope, but Israel will continue to impose restrictions.

events.title: EU's Kallas urges 'more European' NATO amid Trump rupture
events.description: US President Donald Trump has made it clear he doesn't want to support Europe like previous administrations. Europe is now grappling with how best to maintain its own defenses.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.description: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: South Korea's ex-first lady sentenced to prison for bribery
events.description: A South Korean court has sentenced Kim Keon Hee, the wife of disgraced former President Yoon Suk Yeol, to 20 months in prison for corruption.

events.title: Rwanda takes UK to court over contentious migrant deal
events.description: Rwanda accuses the UK of "intransigence" and says London owes it millions of pounds.

events.title: TikTok settles amid looming social media addiction trial
events.description: The social video platform is among the companies facing accusations that their platforms deliberately addict and harm children.

events.title: Netherlands set for minority coalition as parties reach deal
events.description: Three Dutch political parties clinched a coalition deal but will have to rely on support from other parties to govern.

events.title: British PM kickstarts Chinese tour in a bid to reduce dependency on US
events.description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is headed to China for a three day visit. He is seeking a diplomatic and commercial reset between the two countries after years of icy relations. The trip comes as a number of nations including the UK are seeking to reduce their dependency on the US - which has become an increasingly unpredictable and unreliable partner in both geopolitics and trade.

events.title: Starmer in China: What will be on the table?
events.description: It doesn't feel all that long ago that David Cameron took the Chinese leader Xi Jinping for a pint in a Buckinghamshire pub.

events.title: 'Talk to me, Goose': Starmer teases Macron with Top Gun mock up
events.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has poked fun at his French counterpart - by putting on a pair of sunglasses at an event before saying, "bonjour".

events.title: South Korea's former first lady jailed for 20 months for corruption
events.description: The wife of South Korea's former president Yoon Suk Yeol - who was ousted over a martial law bid - has been jailed for 20 months for corruption.

events.title: Sarah Mullally confirmed as archbishop of Canterbury, first woman to lead the church
events.description: Sarah Mullally was confirmed as archbishop of Canterbury on Wednesday, becoming the first woman to lead the Church of England

events.title: Dutch court to rule on climate change case brought by Caribbean islanders
events.description: A court is ruling Wednesday on a case brought by eight residents of a Caribbean island against the Dutch government for not protecting them from climate change

events.title: South Korea's former first lady sentenced to 20 months in prison for corruption
events.description: A South Korean court has sentenced former first lady Kim Keon Hee to 20 months in prison for corruption

events.title: A court sentences South Korea's former first lady Kim Keon Hee to 20 months in prison
events.description: A court sentences South Korea's former first lady Kim Keon Hee to 20 months in prison for corruption

events.title: Japan's last pair of pandas have arrived back in China
events.description: Japan no longer has pandas for the first time in half a century

events.title: What to know about South Sudan's major offensive against opposition forces
events.description: South Sudan’s army has launched a major military operation against opposition forces after recent territorial losses

events.title: Trump-backed businessman Nasry Asfura sworn in as president of Honduras
events.description: Trump-backed businessman Nasry Asfura was sworn in Tuesday as president of Honduras

events.title: French lawmaker recounts trauma in trial of ex-senator accused of drugging her with MDMA
events.description: A French lawmaker seeks "the truth” in the trial in Paris of a former senator accused of drugging her to commit sexual assault

events.title: From family farm to climate tech: How one Kenyan woman is helping farmers outsmart drought
events.description: “Giving up is not an option - so many people depend on you,” the words of Maryanne Gichanga, a participant in a UN supported initiative, which aims to help farmers in Kenya find solutions to alleviate the pressures of climate change on agriculture production.

events.title: Yale to offer free tuition to families making less than $200K, waive all expenses for those making under $100K
events.description: Yale announced free tuition for families earning under $200,000 and full cost coverage for those under $100,000, effective for students entering campus this fall.

events.title: French lawmakers declare 'battle for free minds' after approving social media ban for children under 15
events.description: French lawmakers paved the way for a bill banning social media for children under 15, following Australia's lead in protecting children from digital harm.

events.title: Witkoff celebrates 'new day in the Middle East' after final Israeli hostage is returned from Gaza
events.description: All hostages from Gaza have returned home as Trump administration completes historic Middle East diplomatic achievement, marking end of painful chapter.

events.title: North Korea launches short-range ballistic missiles into sea, show of force ahead of political meetings
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's regime tests ballistic missiles as tensions rise in the region ahead of a massive political party gathering.

events.title: Venezuelan opposition leader says democratic transition would be 'fall of the Berlin Wall' for Americas
events.description: Opposition leader María Corina Machado said she intends to return to Venezuela soon to help drive a democratic transition.

events.title: Israel confirms recovery of last hostage's remains from Gaza
events.description: The remains of Ran Gvili, the final Israeli hostage held by Hamas, have been recovered from Gaza. The police officer died defending Israel on Oct. 7.

events.title: Zelenskyy says US security guarantees document is '100% ready' for signing
events.description: Ukraine's Zelenskyy says U.S. security guarantees document is "100% ready" for signing as trilateral peace talks with Russia expected to continue in Abu Dhabi.
